problem.display_name: Three-qubit quantum code versus three-bit classical code
problem.p: This is a concept question, provided to check your understanding of the previous video clip.
Which of the following statements are correct about the three-qubit bit-flip code, and the three-bit classical repetition code? Check all that apply:

choice.text: The three-qubit bit-flip code is decoded just like majority voting, by measuring the three qubits and computing the majority.
The three-qubit bit flip code can also be used to correct phase flips, by applying Hadamard operators to the three qubits.
The three-qubit bit-flip code must be decoded without measuring the encoded qubit.
The three-qubit bit flip code can correct for single-qubit depolarizing errors.
